result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Floyd Otto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC.
  Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling   OR   Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the DOC and this will be determined by DOC. 
  The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
Def to have NO ABUSIVE Contact w/ KRC
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

timeConds.notes:
30 days jail is Imposed and stayed, to be used by DOC as a sanction or sanctions for non compliance with supervision. 
Granted work release
Granted credit for 2 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Floyd Otto

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Defendant Jacob Floyd Otto in court with attorney Heidi E. Brewer.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. The def will plead to count 1, count 2 will be DRI. withheld sentence with conditions is the agreement.State complied with Vic rights.  Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to be present in the court room. Def PLEADS NC to count 1. The def admits Count 1 was an act of DM, signed PLQ, understands elements. Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G on Count 1, Count 2 is DRi. . State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on sentencing. Def makes statement to the court. 
Ct orders-- See offer to settle
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:20 PM Defendant Jacob Floyd Otto in court with attorney Heidi E. Brewer.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Agreement, asking for PLEAS  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:24 PM Defendant Jacob Floyd Otto in court with attorney Heidi E. Brewer.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Attorney comments -- has received an offer last week -- hasn't spoke w/ client yet. State comments on timing of offer. Def can appear via Zoom for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on March 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:15 AM - Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video means for Defendant Jacob Floyd Otto. Defendant Jacob Floyd Otto appeared by phone means. Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  COVID - ZOOM; rec'd copy compl, waives read, plea mute, N/G enter'd for him.  Parties may ZOOM next dte.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
